briefdescription.para: Gets the configuration.
Creates a new CSV writer using the given TextWriter, a default CsvConfiguration and CsvSerializer as the default serializer.

parameterdescription.para: The writer used to write the CSV file.

briefdescription.para: Creates a new CSV writer using the given TextWriter and CsvConfiguration and CsvSerializer as the default serializer.

parameterdescription.para: The StreamWriter use to write the CSV file.

briefdescription.para: Creates a new CSV writer using the given ICsvSerializer.
Writes the field to the CSV file. The field may get quotes added to it. When all fields are written for a record, ICsvWriter.NextRecord must be called to complete writing of the current record.

Writes the field to the CSV file. This will ignore any need to quote and ignore the CsvConfiguration.QuoteAllFields and just quote based on the shouldQuote parameter. When all fields are written for a record, ICsvWriter.NextRecord must be called to complete writing of the current record.

parameterdescription.para: True to quote the field, otherwise false.

briefdescription.para: Writes the field to the CSV file. When all fields are written for a record, ICsvWriter.NextRecord must be called to complete writing of the current record.
Writes the field to the CSV file. When all fields are written for a record, ICsvWriter.NextRecord must be called to complete writing of the current record.

parameterdescription.para: The converter used to convert the field into a string.

briefdescription.para: Writes the field to the CSV file using the given ITypeConverter. When all fields are written for a record, ICsvWriter.NextRecord must be called to complete writing of the current record.
Writes the field to the CSV file. When all fields are written for a record, ICsvWriter.NextRecord must be called to complete writing of the current record.
Writes the field to the CSV file. When all fields are written for a record, ICsvWriter.NextRecord must be called to complete writing of the current record.

parameterdescription.para: The converter used to convert the field into a string.

briefdescription.para: Ends writing of the current record and starts a new record. This is used when manually writing records with WriteField.
Write the Excel seperator record.
Writes the header record from the given properties.
Writes the header record from the given properties.
Writes the record to the CSV file.
Writes the record to the CSV file.
Writes the list of records to the CSV file.

parameterdescription.para: The list of records to write.

briefdescription.para: Clears the record cache for the given type. After ICsvWriter.WriteRecord{T} is called the first time, code is dynamically generated based on the CsvPropertyMapCollection, compiled, and stored for the given type T. If the CsvPropertyMapCollection changes, ICsvWriter.ClearRecordCache{T} needs to be called to update the record cache.

Clears the record cache for the given type. After ICsvWriter.WriteRecord{T} is called the first time, code is dynamically generated based on the CsvPropertyMapCollection, compiled, and stored for the given type T. If the CsvPropertyMapCollection changes, ICsvWriter.ClearRecordCache(System.Type) needs to be called to update the record cache.

Clears the record cache for all types. After ICsvWriter.WriteRecord{T} is called the first time, code is dynamically generated based on the CsvPropertyMapCollection, compiled, and stored for the given type T. If the CsvPropertyMapCollection changes, ICsvWriter.ClearRecordCache() needs to be called to update the record cache.
Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.
Adds the properties from the mapping. This will recursively traverse the mapping tree and add all properties for reference maps.

parameterdescription.para: The properties to be added to.
The mapping where the properties are added from.

briefdescription.para: Creates a property expression for the given property on the record. This will recursively traverse the mapping to find the property and create a safe property accessor for each level as it goes.

parameterdescription.para: The mapping to look for the property to map on.
The property map to look for on the mapping.

simplesect.para: An Expression to access the given property.

briefdescription.para: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

parameterdescription.para: True if the instance needs to be disposed of.

briefdescription.para: Checks if the instance has been disposed of.
Gets the action delegate used to write the custom class object to the writer.

parameterdescription.para: The type of the custom class being written.

briefdescription.para: Gets the action delegate used to write the custom class object to the writer.

parameterdescription.para: The type of the custom class being written.

briefdescription.para: Creates the write record action for the given type if it doesn't already exist.

parameterdescription.para: The type of the custom class being written.

briefdescription.para: Creates the action for an object.

parameterdescription.para: The type of object to create the action for.

briefdescription.para: Creates the action for a primitive.

parameterdescription.para: The type of primitive to create the action for.

briefdescription.para: Combines the delegates into a single multicast delegate. This is needed because Silverlight doesn't have the Delegate.Combine( params Delegate[] ) overload.

simplesect.para: A multicast delegate combined from the given delegates.

briefdescription.para: Checks if the property can be written.

parameterdescription.para: The property map that we are checking.

simplesect.para: A value indicating if the property can be written. True if the property can be written, otherwise false.

briefdescription.para: Used to write CSV files.
